CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1959, page A14, reads: "Planning Platform Program - This committee of AME Zionites, representing both districts of the Allegheny Conference are making plans for a program, geared to help non delegates in the "On-to-Hartford" drive which will be held at Wesley Center Church, March 1, at 3:30 P.M. Committee members are, seated, left to right: Mmes. Vernell Ramey, Irene Nicholson, Adeline Pollard and Miss Nettye Williams. Standing: The Rev. A. Nicholson, Miss Mable Aston and Mmes. Willa Mae Rice, Irene Glenn, Mozella Irving, and the Rev. G.A. Fitch and Mrs. Jessie Henderson. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of A.M.E. Zion committee members, including seated, left to right: Vernell Ramey, Irene Nicholson, Adeline Pollard, and Nettye Williams; standing, left to right: Rev. A. Nicholson, Mable Aston, Willa Mae Rice, Irene Glenn, Mozella Irving, Rev. G.A. Fitch, and Jessie Henderson, gathered around wooden table planning "On-to-Hartford" drive for Wesley Center Church
